explains: v. 含糊地说，咕哝；（用无齿的牙床）费力嚼咬，咬磨

sentences.en: He spoke in a low mumble, as if to himself.
sentences.cn: 他自言自语般地嘟哝着。

sentences.en: He could hear the low mumble of Navarro's voice.
sentences.cn: 他能听到纳瓦罗的低声咕哝。

sentences.en: "Well," he conceded, "I do sometimes mumble a bit."
sentences.cn: “嗯，”他承认道，“我有时说话确实有点儿含糊。”
